page.title: 02LOLWORTH, NEAR LONGSTANTON
page.content: Lolworth (population 130) is set on a slight slope, overlooking the rest of our D-Block. Although only a few hundred metres from the A604, it seems very peaceful - no doubt because there is no through traffic. The village is clustered around the green and the church, the roads petering out in farm buildings and fields of cereal crops. Lolworth has some rather "grand" houses- not all of them old. Indeed two very spacious ones are being built now.From the green a lane leads to All Saints Church, a building dating from 1406. It has just had extensive repairs and is freshly decorated. The Longstanton Rector has taken over responsibility for Lolworth this year. There are riding stables, a village hall which was once the school,a post-office but no shops.
